alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Judith Basin; Meagher (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 5:49PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Lewis and Clark, northwestern Meagher, northwestern Judith Basin and Cascade Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 549 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles south of Cascade to 24 miles north of White Sulphur Springs. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Cascade, Belt, Geyser, Neihart, Raynesford, Monarch, Eden, Sluice Boxes State Park, Stockett, Tracy, First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park, Centerville, Armington, Ulm and Sand Coulee. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 252 and 278. Highway 200 between mile markers 0 and 23. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central and west central Montana.
